page.title: 03ELIZABETHAN GALLERY
page.content: The Elizabethan Gallery is one of the oldest buildings in Wakefield. It was built in the last years of the reign of Queen Elizabeth the First and was the original Free Grammar School of the City of Wakefield. The gallery is situated between Wakefield market and the central bus station facing on to Brook Street. It is about ten minutes walk from Wakefield Westgate station. There is no parking for cars or coaches by the gallery but the multi- storey car park is only 100 yards away. You can see exhibitions, sculptures and paintings in the gallery and it is open from 10.30 to 12.30 and 1.30 to 5.00p.m. Monday to Saturday. Admission is free.
